text: What is the time complexity of Binary Search?
hint: Each step halves the search space.

text: Which Git command is used to record changes in the local repository?
hint: Creates a snapshot of staged changes.

text: Which SQL clause is used to group rows with the same values?
hint: Often used with aggregate functions like COUNT().

text: Which AI technique learns by interacting with the environment?
hint: Trial and error with rewards and penalties.

text: What does the Python expression `[1, 2] * 2` return?
hint: List multiplication repeats the list.

text: Which register stores the address of the next instruction?
hint: Tracks execution flow.

text: Which data structure uses LIFO principle?
hint: Last in, first out

text: Which SQL command removes a table completely?
hint: Deletes both structure and data.

text: What is the sum of MONDAY?
hint: Sum letter positions with A=0.

text: Which neural network is best for image recognition?
hint: Uses filters and feature maps.

text: Which scheduling algorithm may cause starvation?
hint: Low-priority tasks may be indefinitely delayed if high-priority ones keep arriving.

text: Which SQL command is used to extract data from a database?
hint: Used to query and retrieve rows from tables.

text: Which Git command is used to view the history of commits?
hint: Displays commit history in reverse chronological order.

text: What is the purpose of the activation function in a neural network?
hint: Without it, the network behaves like a linear model.

text: Which SQL join returns all rows from both tables, matching rows where available?
hint: Combines results of both left and right joins.

text: Which company developed the TensorFlow library?
hint: TensorFlow is developed and maintained by Brain.

text: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for routing?
hint: This layer contains data packets and address.

text: Which Git command is used to combine changes from one branch into another?
hint: Used to integrate changes from another branch.

text: Which AI concept refers to a model memorizing training data but failing on new data?
hint: Model performs well on training data but poorly on unseen data.

text: Which SQL keyword removes duplicate rows from a result set?
hint: Used after SELECT to get only unique values.

text: Which command is used in Git to check the current status of files?
hint: Displays tracked, untracked, and staged files.

text: What is RAID used for?
hint: RAID combines drives for speed and fault tolerance.

text: Which AI subfield focuses on enabling computers to understand human language?
hint: Used in chatbots and translation systems.

text: What does the Java code `int x = 5; System.out.println(x++ + ++x);` print?
hint: Post-increment happens after use; pre-increment before use.

text: Which Git command is used to stage changes before committing?
hint: Prepares files for commit by adding them to the staging area.

text: What is the main function of dropout in deep learning?
hint: Randomly ignores some neurons during training to improve generalization.

text: Which Git command creates a new local repository?
hint: Initializes a new Git repository in the current directory.

text: Which SQL statement is used to permanently save changes?
hint: Once executed, changes cannot be rolled back.

text: Which AI concept refers to learning from labeled data?
hint: Training data includes both inputs and expected outputs.

text: Which Git command is used to fetch and merge changes from a remote repository?
hint: Combines fetch and merge in one step.

text: Which programming language is mainly used for AI and ML?
hint: It has rich ML libraries like TensorFlow and PyTorch.

text: Which algorithm is commonly used to update weights in deep learning models?
hint: It minimizes the loss function by adjusting weights step by step.

text:
What will this print?

print(0.1 + 0.2 == 0.3)
hint: Floating point arithmetic introduces precision errors.

text: Which SQL clause filters rows based on a condition?
hint: Used to filter rows before grouping or aggregation.

text: Which Git command creates a copy of a remote repository?
hint: Used to make a full local copy of a remote repository.

text: Which type of neural network is mainly used for image recognition tasks?
hint: Uses filters and feature maps to detect patterns in images.

text: Which SQL keyword is used to sort the result set?
hint: Used to arrange rows in ascending or descending order.

text: Which Git command shows changes between commits?
hint: Displays line-by-line differences between commits or branches.

text: Which AI concept refers to transferring knowledge from one task to another?
hint: Uses pre-trained models to accelerate learning on new tasks.

text: Which SQL command is used to modify existing records?
hint: Changes values in existing rows.

text: Which Git command is used to permanently delete a branch?
hint: Used to delete a local branch safely.

text: Which SQL clause is used to filter grouped rows?
hint: Used after GROUP BY to filter aggregated results.

text: Which AI concept refers to the ability of a model to perform well on unseen data?
hint: The model adapts beyond the training set.

text: Which Git command shows the most recent commits and their hashes?
hint: Displays commit history with metadata.

text: Which SQL keyword is used to add a new row to a table?
hint: Adds new data into a table.

text: Which neural network type is best suited for sequential data?
hint: Maintains memory across time steps.

text: Which Git command lists all branches in the repository?
hint: Displays all local branches.

text: Which SQL command is used to remove all rows from a table but keep its structure?
hint: Deletes all rows quickly without logging each deletion.

text: Which AI concept involves grouping data without labels?
hint: No predefined output — the model finds structure.

text: Which Git command is used to undo the last commit but keep changes?
hint: Removes the commit but preserves staged changes.

text: Which SQL clause is used to rename a column in the result set?
hint: Used to assign an alias to a column or table.

text: Which Git command shows the changes staged for the next commit?
hint: Displays differences between staged files and the last commit.

text: Which AI concept refers to reducing model complexity to prevent overfitting?
hint: Adds penalties to the loss function to discourage complexity.

text: Which SQL command is used to remove specific rows from a table?
hint: Deletes rows based on a WHERE condition.

text: Which Git command is used to revert a commit by creating a new one?
hint: Creates a new commit that undoes the changes of a previous one.

text: Which SQL clause is used to filter rows before grouping?
hint: Filters rows before aggregation occurs.

text: Which Git command is used to view the content of a specific commit?
hint: Displays commit details including changes and metadata.

text: Which SQL function returns the number of rows in a result set?
hint: Used to count rows matching a condition.

text: Which Git command is used to discard changes in the working directory?
hint: Removes untracked files from the working directory.

text: Which SQL clause is used to combine rows from two tables based on a condition?
hint: Combines rows with matching values in specified columns.

text: Which Git command is used to temporarily save changes without committing?
hint: Stores changes for later application without committing.

text: Which SQL clause is used to combine result sets and remove duplicates?
hint: Combines rows from multiple SELECTs and removes duplicates.

text: Which AI concept refers to reducing input dimensions while preserving structure?
hint: Techniques like PCA reduce features while retaining patterns.

text: Which Git command is used to apply stashed changes?
hint: Restores the most recent stash and removes it from the stash list.

text: Which SQL clause is used to limit the number of rows returned?
hint: Restricts the number of rows in the result set.

text: Which AI concept refers to adjusting weights using error gradients?
hint: Uses gradient descent to update weights layer by layer.

text: Which Git command shows the list of stashed changes?
hint: Displays all saved stash entries.

text: Which SQL clause is used to filter rows after aggregation?
hint: Used to filter grouped results based on aggregate conditions.

text: Which Git command is used to discard all local changes?
hint: Resets working directory and index to last commit.

text: Which AI concept refers to training a model on one task and adapting it to another?
hint: Uses knowledge from one domain to improve performance in another.
